newsitem.title: USA: Guardian International buys Alarm Control.
newsitem.headline: Guardian International buys Alarm Control.

text.p: Guardian International Inc said Thursday it completed the acquisition of the customer contracts as well as certain other assets of Alarm Control Inc.
The total cash and stock purchase price amounted to about $2.2 million, Guardian said.
Alarm Control, a privately held company, has about 2,300 alarm subscribers and $63,000 of monthly recurring income, Guardian said.
Terry E. Akins, president of Alarm Control, will become Guardian's chief operating officer and vice president of account acquisitions, Guardian said.
